column1: DRAG Factor = (Detection DRAG factor + Correction DRAG factor) * #Design Units affected
Detection DRAG Factor :- Resource required to detect the problem in conventional method if not known early
Correction DRAG Factor:- Resource required to correct the problem
Total DRAG Factor measured in the analysis = 0

column2: An issue, if not corrected would cause incorrect, unpredictable or ambiguous functional behavior of the silicon
An issue, if not corrected can cause permanent or intermittent failures of the chip
An issue, if not corrected would hamper the testability of the design (on the tester or in-situ operation)
An issue, if not corrected can lead to power-inefficient design
Issues, if not corrected could cause problems in PACT closure ( Performance, Area, Congestion and/or Timing) leading to schedule delays or sub-optimal chip
Any aspect of RTL design that would impact or hinder timing closure in physical design
An issue, if not corrected could cause simulation hangs, inconsistent behavior across simulators, unpredictable results or simulation-synthesis mismatches
An issue, if not corrected could cause synthesis hangs, unpredictable synthesis and inconsistent synthesis across industry standard synthesis tools
An issue, if not corrected, could cause static timing analysis problems
Any aspect of RTL design that could impact smooth running of ATPG tools and possibly testability of a design
Non-conformance to prescribed coding styles in the company
An issue which could make design un-portable or un-reusable across multiple technology nodes or tool flows

column1: Note1: Some of the rules do not have DRAG scores associated with them and are not included in the DRAG measurements. For example, information rules may not have specific design impact and custom rules may not have DRAG factors associated to them. DRAG factor and design impact data can be added/edited and the changes will reflect in the DRAG report results as per the user need
